required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose Ranging Study of ALX-0171 in Infants Hospitalized for Respiratory Syncytial Virus Lower Respiratory Tract Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Dose Ranging Study of ALX-0171 in Infants and Young Children Hospitalized for Respiratory Syncytial Virus Lower Respiratory Tract Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to evaluate the anti-viral effect and safety of different doses of inhaled ALX-0171 in subjects hospitalized for Respiratory Syncytial Virus Lower Respiratory Tract Infection (RSV LRTI). The secondary objective is to evaluate the clinical activity, pharmacokinetic (PK) properties, pharmacodynamic (PD) effect and immunogenicity of different doses of inhaled ALX-0171.

study_design_info.masking: Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor

primary_outcome.measure: Time for viral load to drop below assay quantification limit (BQL)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From day of first dose to 14 days after first dose
primary_outcome.description: Time needed for the viral load to drop below the assay quantification limit (time-to-BQL) in nasal swab specimens.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability as measured by the incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events, clinical laboratory parameters, vital signs and physical examination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 1 day before first dose to 28 days after first dose
From 1 day before first dose to 28 days after first dose
secondary_outcome.description: Evolution over time in Global Severity Score

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 1 day before first dose to 28 days after first dose
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the clinical response of the subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics as measured by the concentration of ALX-0171 in serum
Evolution over time of viral load in nasal swab specimens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day of first dose to 14 days after first dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity as measured by the concentration of anti-ALX 0171 antibodies in serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 1 day before first dose to 14 days after first dose

clinical_study.condition: Respiratory Syncytial Virus Lower Respiratory Tract Infection

arm_group.description: Inhalation of ALX-0171 Dose 1 once daily for 3 consecutive days
Inhalation of ALX-0171 Dose 2 once daily for 3 consecutive days
Inhalation of ALX-0171 Dose 3 once daily for 3 consecutive days
Inhalation of Placebo once daily for 3 consecutive days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is otherwise healthy, but is hospitalized for and clinically diagnosed with RSV LRTI
- Subject has a positive RSV diagnostic test.
- Symptoms likely related to RSV infection have appeared within 4 days of screening and are not yet improving at screening.
Others as defined in the protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject is known to have significant comorbidities
- Subject is known to be human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)-positive
- Subject is known to be immunocompromised
- Subject has or is suspected to have an active, clinically relevant concurrent infection Others as defined in the protocol
